New Records: Germany became the first side in European Championship history to have two players aged 21 or under score for them in the same game
Toni Kroos played 102 passes across the game — more than any player on the pitch
Key Match Events: Julian Nagelsmann’s side 3-0 up at half-time and a man to the good after Ryan Porteous was sent off for a horror tackle on Ilkay Gundogan
Germany ended up wearing them down with passes, as eventually No 10 Ilkay Gundogan found space between the lines, which led to the second goal and then a penalty which VAR overturned
Pre-Game Insights: Experts were aware of the officiating focus on player safety and punishing tackles
Steve Clarke’s men may have been humbled by a rampant German side — playing with 10 men for over 45 minutes
Post-Match Reflections: Steve Clarke was understandably subdued after the game
We feel as if we’ve let ourselves down. We’re better than that. We’re a better team than we showed tonight and hopefully we can show that in the next two games
Julian Nagelsmann was keen to stress the value of his team, rather than individuals like Jamal Musiala and Florian Wirtz
Miscellaneous Highlights: The new UEFA initiative made it a bookable offence for players to approach referees to prevent them from being “mobbed”, with any player showing any sign of disrespect or dissent being shown a yellow card
The game was marked by a welcome calmness from the players when a contentious decision did arise
